post.body: Broken Space is in my Bio here, if you haven't gotten that one already.
About halfway through Fool Moon. Gotta replace writing tomorrow with more drawing to keep up the buffer. Now: sleep. G'night.
Making dinner. I don't think I can fiddle with Genius anymore, though I need to remove some of the older restrictions on Wonder use.
Oof. Rolled over 180,000 words on Genius. I feel like I can't write another syllable, but I still have more to do.
At the rest of the red beans and rice from Wayne's for lunch. Finishing up another chunk of Genius, feeling pleased with myself.
Back from a grocery shopping excursion. Now to...write? Draw? I kinda need to do both. Let's open things up and see where the winds take me.
Awake and waiting for Kirsten to get dressed. I'm going to drop her off in Northampton so she can buy me Christmas presents. Woot!
After lots of Genius work, an update for Broken Space: http://www.brokenspacecomic.com/v7p17.html I like the airship.
Working on the adventure-design guide for Genius. I hope this is useful to people who run the game. I hope someone runs the game!
Blorb...Back from Wayne's Big Mamou. I think I ate too much Mamou. I'm too full to read. I didn't think that was possible.
Ripping through the Storytelling section for Genius--hopefully offering good advice. Now to clean up and fetch Kirsten.
I'm working on the Storytelling chapter of Genius, trying to explain what I think makes a good game. I think what I'm writing makes sense.
Alright, Kirsten is deposited at work and I ran my silly little errands. I drew yesterday, so today's working on Genius.
Been figuring out what sort of art I want for Genius. I think I can pull something off on my own.
Broken Space's ads haven't dropped below $4.00 all day. A harbinger of better days to come, or a cruel, bitter joke?
Returned from the doctor without any kind of nightmare diagnosis. Now to rescue Kirsten and--I suppose--find some food.
Wow, the inking looks pretty good. It's weird to--increasingly--look at my comic pages and think, Hey, that looks like what I want it to be.
Almost done with the inking. Unfortunately I've fallen into Wikipedia and now I'm learning about Hellenic magical beliefs. No! Must draw!
The sketching is done. Watching an interview with Ben "Yahtzee" Croshaw on my coffee break before I start inking.
Just worked up some antagonists for Genius. But now it's time to go to bed. I want to be up early tomorrow to draw another comic page.
Just watched Goldfinger. I'm enjoying this pile of James Bond DVDs way more than I have any right to. Back to work tomorrow, though.
Oh, fun! I get to do another one of those 3x3 "action grids" for the next comic page. These are good practice for Water Phoenix King.
Awake and surrounded by Christmas presents, almost entirely devoid of ambition.
Back from the extended family Christmas. I got a Trivial Pursuit game. Kirsten got enough coffee to launch a hippo into the asteroid belt.
Reading...what am I up to?...Grave Peril to Kirsten. Butcher's really finding his voice in this one. Also eating cheese. Mm, cheese.
Alright, all the limbs appear to work. Later today I'm off to my extended family's Christmas, with all the...excitement...that entails.
Reading more Dresden Files to Kirsten, who enjoys nothing more than projecting every geeky malfunction onto the character of Harry Dresden.
Just watched In Bruges. It was as unexpectedly good as everyone's said. Minimalist and indirect in the tradition of Reservoir Dogs.
Another comic page drawn. Now to read How To Make Webcomics. Maybe I should've done it t'o ther way 'round.
My sense of perspective is still pretty gross. I'm going to need to play more first-person shooters or something.
Attempting to decipher and exploit Facebook for my own nefarious ends. Also, on to the coloring.
I keep thinking that I should use Facebook more, but...for what? Also, all the people I like are friends with people I hate.
Just ate a plate of bread, cheese, and meat. In one hour: a duel at the Hotel de Ville. No, wait, I mean I should be done with shading.
Mostly done with the inking. Apparently my Christmas present to myself was finishing the penciling on the 24th and then forgetting I did it.
New comic: http://www.brokenspacecomic.com/v7p21.html My anatomy continues to improve, but my perspective is still wonky.
A Wii Fit for my lazy ass, Kurtz and Co's book on making webcomics, an Eisner book on comics, a six-pack of Bond movies, and exotic cocoas!
I have so much Christmas stuff. So...much...stuff. And I need to get my butt back to work tomorrow! But...so much stuff.
Alright, time to pick Kirsten up from work and do the whole Christmas thing with the family.
Sketch sketch sketch, read read read. I'm not being productive, as such, but I'm also not comatose. I'll call this day a win.
Mornin'. Comic is up: http://www.brokenspacecomic.com/v7p20.html Working on the next one. Well, the NEXT next one, technically.
